tool.name: massPix
tool.description: Processes high resolution mass spectrometry imaging data, performs multivariate statistics (PCA, clustering) and lipid identification.
tool.command:
## cd $imzML_file.extra_files_path &&
## ## Change uploaded imzml files. Also make them re-useable. ## [ -f "data.imzml" ] || mv *imzml* data.imzml && ## [ -f "data.ibd" ] || mv *ibd* data.ibd &&
ln -s '${imzML_file.extra_files_path}/imzml' data.imzml && ln -s '${imzML_file.extra_files_path}/ibd' data.ibd &&
Rscript ${__tool_directory__}/massPix.R --imzML_file data.imzml ## --imzML_file $imzML_file.extra_files_path/data.imzml
--process $process.process_selector #if $process.process_selector:
## Making library --ionisation_mode $process.make_library.ionisation_mode --fixed $process.make_library.fixed --fixed_FA $process.make_library.fixed_FA
## mz_extractor --thres_int $process.mz_extractor.thres_int --thres_low $process.mz_extractor.thres_low --thres_high $process.mz_extractor.thres_high
## peak_piucker_bin --bin_ppm $process.peak_piucker_bin.bin_ppm
## subset_image --percentage_deiso $process.subset_image.percentage_deiso
## filter --steps $process.filter.steps --thres_filter $process.filter.thres_filter
## deisotope --ppm $process.deisotope.ppm --no_isotopes $process.deisotope.no_isotopes --prop_1 $process.deisotope.prop_1 --prop_2 $process.deisotope.prop_2 --search_mod $process.deisotope.search_mod --mod '$process.deisotope.mod' ## wl-25-11-2017, Sat: Must add single quotes here since mod ## content includes parentheses. Otherwise error: ## syntax error near unexpected token `('
## annotate --ppm_annotate $process.annotate.ppm_annotate
## normalise --norm_type $process.normalise.norm_type.norm_type_selector #if $process.normalise.norm_type.norm_type_selector == 'standards': --standards $process.normalise.norm_type.standards #end if
## save processed image --image_out $image_out #if $process.rdata: --rdata_out $rdata_out #end if #else: --image_file $process.image_file #end if
## plot --scale $plot.scale --nlevels $plot.nlevels --res_spatial $plot.res_spatial --rem_outliers $plot.rem_outliers --summary $plot.summary --title $plot.title
--pca $pca.pca_selector #if $pca.pca_selector: --pca_out $pca_out --scale_type $pca.pca_plot.scale_type --transform $pca.pca_plot.transform --PCnum $pca.pca_plot.PCnum --loading $pca.pca_plot.loading #if $pca.pca_plot.loading: --loading_out $loading_out #end if #end if
--slice $slice.slice_selector #if $slice.slice_selector: --slice_out $slice_out --row $slice.slice_plot.row #end if
--clus $cluster.cluster_selector #if $cluster.cluster_selector: --clus_out $clus_out --cluster_type $cluster.cluster_plot.cluster_type --clusters $cluster.cluster_plot.clusters --intensity $cluster.cluster_plot.intensity #if $cluster.cluster_plot.intensity: --intensity_out $intensity_out #end if #end if

param.name: imzML_file
param.label: Choose an imzml composite file
param.help: imzml file contains imaging meta data. The imaging binary data file (*.ibd) contains the mass spectral data. The two files must be uploaded as an 'imzml' 'composite' data type via 'Get Data'.

param.label: Process mass spectrometry imaging data
param.name: process_selector
param.help: Choose if you want to process MSI data or only visualise processed MSI data.

param.name: ionisation_mode
param.label: Specify ionisation mode
param.help: Choose 'positive' or 'negative', will determine which lipid classes are in database

param.name: fixed
param.label: SN position fixed or not
param.help: Defines if one of the SN positions is fixed, default is false.

param.name: fixed_FA
param.label: Fixed FA
param.help: Defines the name of the fixed FA eg 16, 18.1, 20.4.

param.name: thres_int
param.label: Intensity threshold
param.help: Defines the intensity threshold, above which ions are retained

param.name: thres_low
param.label: Minumum m/z threshold
param.help: Defines the minimum m/z threshold, above which ions will be retained

param.name: thres_high
param.label: Maximum m/z threshold
param.help: Defines the maximum m/z threshold, below which ions will be retained

section.name: peak_piucker_bin
section.title: Bin all m/zs by ppm bucket

param.name: bin_ppm
param.label: Bin width (ppm)
param.help: Mass accuracy for binning between spectra. Suggest starting with 10 ppm bin width for data acquired with mass resolving power 60,000 at m/z 400; increase/decrease with lower/higher resolving power, respectively. Used to group common ions across all spectra (pixels) where ions are measured with slightly different m/z.

section.name: subset_image
section.title: Generate subset of first image file to improve speed of deisotoping

param.name: percentage_deiso
param.label: Proportion of deisotoping
param.help: Defines the proportion of total pixels to select, at random from the first file to produce a subset of the image

section.name: filter
section.title: Filter to a matrix subset that includes variables above a threshold of missing values

param.name: steps
param.label: Steps for filtering
param.help: This produces a sequence of values between 0 and 1 that defines the thresholds of missing values to test. Do not change this value from 0.05 but rather change Threshold for filtering to adjust missing value tolerance.

param.name: thres_filter
param.label: Threshold for filtering
param.help: Defines threshold for proportion of missing values (this is the step number, not the actual proportion). Range is 1-21, where each step size corresponds to an increase in 0.05 (5 %) missing values allowed. For example: Step 1: 0 threshold - no missing values allowed (feature must be present in at least 100% pixels) Step 6: 0.25 threshold -25 % missing values allowed (feature must be present in at least 75 % pixels) Step 11: 0.5 threshold - 50 % missing values allowed (feature must be present in at least 50 % pixels) Step 16: 0.75 threshold - 75 % missing values allowed (feature must be present in at least 25 % pixels) Step 21: 1 threshold - 100 % missing values allowed (feature must be present in at least 0 % pixels).

section.name: deisotope
section.title: Perform deisotoping on a subset of the image

param.name: ppm
param.label: Tolerance (ppm)
param.help: Tolerance (ppm) within which mass of isotope must be within

param.name: no_isotopes
param.label: Number of isotopes
param.help: Number of isotopes to consider (1 or 2)

param.name: prop_1
param.label: First Proportion
param.help: Proportion of monoisotope intensity the 1st isotope intensity must not exceed

param.name: prop_2
param.label: Second proportion
param.help: Proportion of monoisotope intensity the 2nd isotope intensity must not exceed

param.name: search_mod
param.label: Search modifications
param.help: Search modifications T/F.

param.name: mod
param.value: c(NL = T, label = F, oxidised = F, desat = F)
param.label: Specify modifications to search
param.help: Modifications to search eg. c(NL=T, label=F, oxidised=T,desat=T). NL = neutral loss of head group or water; label = 13C palmitate lablled; desat = 1 to 4 additional desaturations. Set to true (T) or false (F).

section.name: annotate
section.title: Perform putative annotation on deisotoped image

param.name: ppm_annotate
param.label: Specify ppm threshold for annotation
param.help: Defines ppm threshold for which |observed m/z - theoretical m/z| must be less than for annotation to be retained. Suggest to use same mass tolerance as bin width.

param.name: norm_type_selector
param.label: Select a method for normalisation
param.help: Mode of normalisation

param.name: standards
param.label: Specify vector of row
param.help: Vector of row indices corresponding to variables that are standards. The input format should follow the example: 'c(1,3:21,35)' where ':' stands for the range. If the input is 'NULL', all rows will be used.

param.name: rdata
param.label: Save all R running results
param.help: Save all running results for inspection

param.name: image_file
param.label: Choose processed data
param.help: Choose processed data file for PCA or clustering analysys

param.name: scale
param.label: Specify scale range
param.help: Range of scale that intensity values will be scaled to.

param.name: nlevels
param.label: Specify Graduations
param.help: Graduations of colour scale.

param.name: res_spatial
param.label: Specify spatial resolution
param.help: Spatial resolution of image

param.name: rem_outliers
param.label: Remove outliers or not
param.help: Remove intensities that are outliers or not

param.name: summary
param.label: Give summary information or not
param.help: Summary information with boxplot and histogram

param.name: title
param.label: Show plot title or not
param.help: Provide plot title for outlier handling.

param.name: pca_selector
param.label: Generate PCA plot
param.help: Select generating a PCA plot or not

param.name: scale_type
param.label: Select a method for scaling
param.help: Mode of scaling. Valid argument: center, center and pareto, pareto and none

param.name: transform
param.label: Transformation or not
param.help: Log transform data T/F

param.name: PCnum
param.label: Specify PCs
param.help: Number of PCs to consider

param.name: loading
param.label: Save loading values
param.help: Save loading values for inspection.

param.name: slice_selector
param.label: Plot ion slice or not
param.help: Make ion slice if requested

param.name: row
param.label: Specify which row for plotting
param.help: Row number to plot - this can be determined by opening the processed image data file.

param.name: cluster_selector
param.label: Perform clustering or not
param.help: Perform clustering or not

param.name: cluster_type
param.label: Select a clustering method
param.help: Currently only 'kmeans' supported

param.name: clusters
param.label: Specify cluster numbers
param.help: Number of clusters to use

param.name: intensity
param.label: Save cluster intensity values
param.help: Save cluster intensity for inspection.

tool.help:
massPix =======
Description -----------
massPix_ processes high resolution mass spectrometry imaging data, performs multivariate statistics (PCA, clustering) and lipid identification.
The overall data processing workflow consists of initial data pre-processing, filtering, image subsetting, deisotoping, annotation, normalisation, scaling, image "slicing" and multivariate statistics.
Data in imzML format is parsed to R. Ions with intensities greater than a threshold, from each spectra, are extracted and grouped to user-adjustable mass bins. Spectral features are defined by the median m/z value in each bin, and only features detected above a threshold proportion of spectra are retained. Average intensities for all features from a random subset of pixels are computed and used to perform deisotoping. The deisotoping algorithm identifies the molecular ion (M) and removes isotopes at m/z (M+1) and (M+2) which are within a calculated proportion of the intensity of M.
Putative lipid annotation by accurate mass is achieved by searching deisotoped ions against a generated library of lipid m/z ratios computed for all combinations of common fatty acids, lipid head-groups and anticipated adducts in each ionisation mode (functions: ``makelibrary`` and ``annotate``). The criteria for a match can be adjusted according to different MS performance capabilities. Lipid classes searched in positive ion mode are diacylglycerides (DAG), triacylglycerides (TAG), phosphatidylcholines (PC), phosphatidylethanolamines (PE), phosphatidylserines (PS), LysoPC, cholesteryl esters (CE), sphingomyelins (SM) and ceramides (Cer). In negative ion mode, lipid classes searched are PC, phosphatidic acid (PA), PE, PS, phosphatidylglycerols (PG), phosphatidylinositols (PI), Cer and free fatty acids (FFA). Whilst this list is not exhaustive, it does cover the most common lipid classes. Possible adducts considered are [M+K]+, [M+H]+, [M+Na]+, [M+NH4]+ in positive ion mode and [M–H]-, [M+Cl]-, [M+OAc]- in negative ion mode. It is important to point out that a database hit based on accurate mass should only be considered the first step in metabolite identification, and confirmation carried out using MS/MS is required, where this appropriate.
massPix_ has the further capability to perform difference matching on deisotoped features to search for mass differences associated with measurement-introduced alternation (e.g. loss of headgroup, loss of water) or biological modifications (e.g. oxidation). The final image DIMS data**
The lipidomics data format is ``mzXML`` which can be converted from raw data by ``MSConvert`` of ProteoWizard_. Each file represents one sample or replicate. Select multiple ``mzXML`` files for processing. The input data will be either positive or negative mode. They cannot be mixed up.
.. _ProteoWizard: http://proteowizard.sourceforge.net/
Inputs ------
**\1. Choose an imzml composite file**
imzml composite file actually includes two files, ``.imzml`` and ``.ibd``. The former file contains imaging meta data while the later is the imaging binary mass spectral data. The two files must be uploaded as an ``imzml composite`` data type via ``Get Data``.
**\2. Choose processed data**
If you have processed MSI data and saved the results as a tubular data before, you can upload it for further analysis such as PCA and clustering analysis.
Beware that you still need to load the imzml composite file even you do not intend to process again.
Parameters ----------
The parameter setting is for processing image data and plotting. Each section gives a brief description how to choose these parameters.
Outputs -------
**\1. Processed image data**
The processed image is saved in a tubular format:

All running results are saved as an R file ``rdata`` for advanced user to further analysis.
**\3. PCA plots** (OPTIONAL)
PCA as well as its loading are plotted. Also the loading values are saved as an Excel file. (OPTIONAL)

Besides the cluster plots, the cluster intensity values can be saved as a tabular format. (OPTIONAL)
